unit.name: Panzer Lehr Division HQ
unit.History: The Panzer Lehr Division was formed early 1944 from various training and exhibition units. The division was better equipped than any other panzer division in the army; all its panzergrenadier battalions were mechanized. The Panzer Lehr Division fought in Normandy, mainly against the Americans, and suffered heavy losses. It saw action in Lorraine in October 1944 before being transferred to the Ardennes.

commander.Name: Fritz Bayerlein
commander.PersBio:
Fritz Bayerlein joined the German Army at the age of eighteen and fought on the Western Front during the First World War with the 9th Bavarian Infantry Regiment.
Bayerlein remained in the army and as Major, served under General Heinz Guderian as his First General Staff Officer during the campaign in Poland. Bayerlein also served under Guderian during the 1940 invasion of France.
In October 1941, Bayerlein was sent to North Africa where he briefly became commander of the Deutsches Afrika Korps when General Walther Nehring was wounded at Alam Halfa in August 1942. When General Wilhelm von Thoma was captured at El Alamein Bayerlein once again resumed control during the retreat to Tunisia.
In October 1943 Bayerlein was sent to the Russian Front to command the 3rd Panzer Division. Three months later he became commander of the elite Panzer Lehr Division.
